'''Vanna Bonta''' is a novelist, poet and film actress best known as the author of ''Flight: A Quantum Fiction Novel'' (Meridian House 1996)<ref>[http://velocityebooks.com/quantum/flight.html Flight: a quantum fiction novel, by Vanna Bonta]; book reviews</ref> <ref>[http://blog.panorama.it/libri/2008/01/16/quantum-fiction-quando-la-quantistica-detta-le-leggi-della-scrittura/ Quantum Fiction] quando la quantistica detta le leggi della scrittura, by Maria Zuppello; Panorama Mondadori, January 16, 2008</ref> the story about parallel dimensions featuring an amnesiac girl with no navel. She is also known for collections of award-winning poetry as well as for a cameo role as Zed's queen, the hero's young mother, in the fantasy movie ''[[The Beastmaster (film)|The Beastmaster]]''.
She is also the inventor of the [[2suit]].<ref>[http://www.inventorsdigest.com/?p=591 Inventors Digest], May 2009; Issue 25, Vol. 5</ref><ref>[http://www.americanchronicle.com/articles/view/101039 American Chronicle] - May 02, 2009; Vanna Bonta Does Inventor's Digest: New Meaning To Beautiful</ref><ref>[http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/14002908/ Outer-space sex carries complications] by Alan Boyle, Science editor; MSNBC News, July 24, 2006</ref>
A portrait of her as a young girl was drawn by Florentine artist [[Pietro Annigoni]].<ref>[http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1747307/ Pietro Annigoni] biography imdb</ref>
She was a model of Woman for the [[Frederick Hart (sculptor)|Frederick Hart]] work "Creation of Mankind" (Ex Nihilo) on the front entrance of the [[Washington National Cathedral]] in Washington D.C.<ref>[http://www.news-inside.com/1682/the-things-they-say-vanna-bonta.htm News Inside] July 6, 2006</ref>
Bonta appeared in [[List of The Universe episodes|The Universe Season 3 Episode 4 "Sex in Space"]] and talked about how her [[2suit]] could be used to achieve intimacy in [[microgravity]] toward the colonization of other planets. The [[History Channel]] documentary filmed her testing the 2suit in [[weightlessness]], which marked Bonta's second zero gravity flight.<ref>[http://www.nowpublic.com/world/universe-sex-space-marks-new-era-mankind The Universe: Sex in Space Marks New Era For Mankind?] Now Public (December 1, 2008)</ref> <ref>[http://shop.history.com/detail.php?p=78046&v=history_show_the-universe History Channel: The Universe: Sex in Space]</ref> She is an advocate with The [[Space Frontier Foundation]].
She is the daughter of an Italian fine-arts painter and American military officer, and the granddaughter of [[Luigi Ugolini]].<ref>[http://www.huliq.com/65654/space-foundation-gives-nod-poetry-awards-vanna-bonta Space Foundation Gives Nod To Poetry] Huliq News; August 2, 2008</ref>
Bonta wrote an undeveloped story, "Somewhen", for the first season of ''[[Star Trek: The Next Generation]]''.<ref>[https://www.mycomicshop.com/search?TID=22013707 Untold Tales of the Next Generation] Schuster & Schuster 1989; ISBN# 1-55698-215-1</ref> <ref>[http://memory-alpha.org/wiki/Undeveloped_Star_Trek_episodes Undeveloped Star Trek episodes]</ref> She is credited with numerous roles as a voice actor in feature films, such as ''[[Beauty and the Beast (1991 film)|Beauty and the Beast]]'' ([[Disney]]). <ref>[http://www.fandango.com/vannabonta/filmography/p7324 Vanna Bonta filmography] Fandango</ref> She was the computer voice in the movie ''[[Demolition Man (film)|Demolition Man]]''.
